result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brice A. Schambow

records.addlTxt: Hearing on December 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:44 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Brice A. Schambow in court.  Attorney Thomas J. Schneck in court for Brice A. Schambow.  Prosecuting attorney Shawn N Woller in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Schneck provides an update; he has discovery but they are still waiting for blood and drug test results.  Atty. Schneck also notes he has not discussed a resolution with the State yet so he is requesting the matter be set for another further proceedings date.  Court also notes there was a WCS non-compliance report and admonishes the defendant and reminds him he must comply with all conditions of bail including WCS monitoring.  Atty. Schneck requests another further proceedings date in about 30-60 days.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Court also confirmed with the defendant the address on file is his current address.
Hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Filed by Atty. Schneck in response to the WCS non-compliance letter filed on 10/11/2022.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter dated 10/11/22 received and filed.  **Reviewed by Judge Reilly, for Branch 7, 10/12/22 - Court to address at the 10/24/22 hearing.**
Hearing on October 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Filed by Atty. Schneck.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

8:17 AM Defendant Brice A. Schambow in court.  Attorney Thomas J. Schneck in court for Brice A. Schambow.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 26, 2022 at 08:15 am.

CONDITIONS MODIFIED 08/12/2022:  Defendant to have no unsupervised contact with the three elementary aged children.   Defendant is not to drive in any motor vehicle with any minor.  

PREVIOUS CONDITIONS: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant to have no contact with citizen callers listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with drug testing through WCS.  Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols.  Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.

1:02 PM Defendant Brice A. Schambow in court.  Attorney Thomas J. Schneck in court for Brice A. Schambow. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. 
 Attorney Schneck requests a modification to the conditions of bond to be that the defendant is not to operate any motor vehicle in which the children are passengers and requests supervised contact with the elementary school aged children.  Attorney Shneck provides the protective plan information to the Court for review.  State has no objection to this request.  Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:15 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key. Signed by Judge Paul Reilly on 8/11/22
Filed by Atty. Schneck.

Adjustment Number: 22A 031239,
Payable Number: 471887,
Receipt Number: 22R 033803,
Amount: $20.00

ADDRESS INFO for Brice A. Schambow
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 08-08-2022)
Prior: 121 Monroe St, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538
Hearing on August 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant to have no contact with citizen callers/three elementary aged children listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with drug testing through WCS.  Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols.  Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.

02:22 PM Defendant Brice A. Schambow in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Law Intern Patrick Sicula.   Alyssa M Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mr. Sicula appears as friend of the court.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
WCS Pre-trial Report
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
